How to install¶

Here is the guide on how to install the Imaging-Transcriptomics tool so you can run it from your command line. We recommend using anaconda to manage your installation of the imaging-transcriptomics package.

To run the script you will need to install two additional packages not listed in pip, which are:

  • pyls, to perform partial least squares regression

  • spatialnulls, to perform the permutation of cortical brain areas maintaining the autocorrelation of the brain.

Both this packages are available from Github.

Setting up your environment¶

A quick way to have the script setup and running is to create a conda environment, install the previously mentioned packages and then install the script.

Warning

To set up the environment you will need to have anaconda and Git installed.

An example of how to create the environment is:

$ conda create --name imaging_transcriptomics python=3.7 pip
$ conda activate imaging_transcriptomics
$ git clone https://github.com/netneurolab/markello_spatialnulls
$ cd markello_spatialnulls/
$ conda env update -f environment.yml
$ cd ..
$ git clone https://github.com/rmarkello/pyls.git
$ cd pyls
$ python setup.py install

The previous list of commands will create a conda environment (named imaging_transcriptomics) with the packages needed to run the imaging_transcriptomics package.

Installation¶

To install the package (once the previous step) is completed run from your termianl the command:

$ pip install imaging_transcriptomics

Now you’re all set to run your imaging transcriptomics analyses! Check out our getting started guide and our usage to learn how to use the script or the rest of the documentation to learn a bit more about the methods.
